title: Polylogism

articles.content:
Polylogism is the doctrine that there is not one correct logic, one correct
method of reasoning necessarily binding on all men, but that there are many
logics, each valid for some men and invalid for the others. The polylogist
divides men into groups, and holds that each group has by nature (or creates
for itself by choice) its own distinctive method of inference based on its own
distinctive logical laws, so that the inferences that are entirely logical for
one group are entirely illogical for the others . . .
articles.attribution:
Leonard Peikoff, “Nazi Politics,”
The Objectivist, Feb. 1971, 12

acknowledgement:
